principles.name: Purposeful Motion
principles.description: Every animation serves a clear purpose - guiding attention, providing feedback, or revealing relationships. Motion enhances understanding, never distracts.
principles.rationale: Oitavo Café is about results and clarity. Motion should reinforce the message, not compete with it.

principles.name: Smooth Confidence
principles.description: Transitions feel smooth and assured, like a confident professional who knows what they're doing. Not rushed, not hesitant - just right.
principles.rationale: The brand promises ROI and systematic results. Motion should feel as reliable and confident as the service.

principles.name: Coffee-Like Flow
principles.description: Movement flows like pouring coffee - smooth, gradual, with natural momentum. Ease curves mimic liquid physics: slow start, smooth middle, gentle finish.
principles.rationale: Coffee is the brand heritage. Motion should evoke the same warmth and natural fluidity.

principles.name: Respectful Subtlety
principles.description: Animations are noticeable but not showy. They support the user's task without demanding attention. Subtle enough to feel premium, clear enough to be functional.
principles.rationale: Carolina (the persona) is skeptical and results-focused. She'll appreciate motion that helps, but resent motion that wastes her time.

principles.name: Accessibility First
principles.description: All motion respects prefers-reduced-motion. Critical feedback never relies solely on animation. Motion enhances but is never required.
principles.rationale: Professional service means inclusive service. Everyone deserves clarity and usability.

duration.description: Duration scale based on perceptual timing, not mathematical progression. Longer durations for complex transitions, shorter for simple state changes.

slow.usage: Rare - used for emphasis or complex coordination

guidelines.default: Use 'base' (300ms) when unsure - it feels natural for most interactions
guidelines.mobile: Consider reducing durations by 50-100ms on mobile for snappier feel
guidelines.reduced-motion: Set all durations to 0ms or use 'instant' when prefers-reduced-motion is active
guidelines.stagger: When animating multiple elements, stagger start times by 50-80ms for smooth flow

easing.description: Easing curves inspired by natural physics and coffee pour dynamics. Smooth, gradual, confident.

standard.name: Standard Ease
standard.usage: Default for most transitions - balanced and neutral

decelerate.name: Decelerate (Ease Out)
decelerate.usage: Elements entering the screen or expanding
decelerate.feel: Like setting down a coffee cup - starts with momentum, ends gently

accelerate.name: Accelerate (Ease In)
accelerate.usage: Elements leaving the screen or collapsing
accelerate.feel: Like picking up a cup - slow start, gaining momentum

emphasized.name: Emphasized Decelerate
emphasized.feel: Coffee pouring - smooth flow with gentle landing

gentle.name: Gentle
gentle.feel: Warm and approachable - like the brand personality

guidelines.entering: Use 'decelerate' or 'emphasized' - elements slow down as they arrive
guidelines.exiting: Use 'accelerate' - elements speed up as they leave
guidelines.bidirectional: Use 'standard' for transitions that go both ways
guidelines.important: Use 'emphasized' for success states, important feedback, ROI reveals
guidelines.utility: Use 'sharp' for functional interactions where clarity trumps beauty

microinteractions.description: Small, purposeful animations that provide feedback and delight. Coffee-inspired where appropriate.

hover.rationale: Subtle lift suggests interactivity without theatrics

active.rationale: Quick compression confirms the click registered

properties.spinner: Rotating circle on primary-600 (2s linear infinite)

loading.rationale: Clear feedback that system is working

success.rationale: Celebrates success - important for ROI-focused users

focus.rationale: Clear focus state for accessibility and clarity

validation_error.rationale: Gentle but clear error indication - shake draws attention without being aggressive

autocomplete.rationale: Smooth reveal feels helpful, not jarring

properties.knob: Slide with slight decelerate at end

switch.rationale: Quick, precise - matches the physical metaphor

checkbox.rationale: Fast enough to feel instant, smooth enough to be satisfying

appear.rationale: Appears when needed, not distracting when hovering through

ripple.description: Material Design-inspired ripple for touch feedback
ripple.usage: Optional on buttons/cards for tactile feedback on mobile
ripple.rationale: Confirms touch registration - especially useful on mobile

open.rationale: Backdrop fades first to establish context, then dialog scales in smoothly

close.rationale: Dialog exits first, backdrop lingers briefly to avoid jarring transition

slide_in.rationale: Smooth slide from edge - feels like pulling out information

slide_out.rationale: Quicker exit - user has dismissed, get out of the way

expand.rationale: Natural reveal - like opening a book

collapse.rationale: Faster collapse - user is navigating away

switch.rationale: Quick, precise switch - maintains clarity during content change

properties.items: Optional stagger (30ms between items) for menus with 5+ items

open.rationale: Quick reveal - user is navigating, don't slow them down

properties.timing: Slight bounce at end (scale 1 → 1.02 → 1) for important notifications

enter.rationale: Slides in from edge to draw attention without blocking content

exit.rationale: Smooth exit that doesn't cause layout shift

properties.transform: translateX calculated based on slide width

slide.rationale: Smooth, confident transition - fast enough to feel responsive, slow enough to track

loading_patterns.description: Loading states that maintain trust and reduce perceived wait time

spinner.rationale: Simple, professional, doesn't distract from message

design.animation: Gradient sweep (linear-gradient translating from left to right)

skeleton.usage: Page load, content fetch, list population
skeleton.rationale: Shows structure immediately - reduces perceived loading time by 20-30%

progress_bar.easing: standard for updates, decelerate for final 90-100%
progress_bar.usage: File upload, multi-step forms, data processing
progress_bar.rationale: Gives concrete feedback on progress - builds trust

pulse.usage: Live data indicator, real-time updates, 'thinking' state

dots.easing: decelerate for up, accelerate for down
dots.usage: Typing indicators, processing states, conversational interfaces
dots.rationale: Friendly and approachable - matches brand personality

design.concept: Coffee pouring into cup (simple line illustration)
design.colors: primary-700 for liquid, neutral-600 for cup
design.animation: Liquid level rises with slight bubble/foam effect at top

coffee_pour.usage: Initial page load, major transitions, 'brewing results' for ROI calculations
coffee_pour.rationale: Reinforces coffee heritage, turns wait time into brand moment
coffee_pour.note: Use sparingly - only when wait time > 2 seconds and moment is significant

page_transitions.description: Smooth transitions between pages/views that maintain context

standard_page.rationale: Smooth crossfade with subtle vertical movement - feels like turning a page

hierarchical_navigation.description: Going deeper into content (e.g., list → detail)
hierarchical_navigation.rationale: Spatial metaphor helps user maintain mental model of navigation stack

tab_navigation.rationale: Fast, functional - user is switching contexts at same hierarchy level

data_visualization.description: Animations for charts, graphs, and ROI displays

chart_reveal.rationale: Smooth reveal helps user process data - especially important for ROI metrics

properties.animation: JavaScript-based counter from 0 to final value

value_count_up.usage: ROI percentages, revenue numbers, conversion rates
value_count_up.rationale: Counting up creates anticipation and emphasizes positive results

properties.highlight: Brief accent-500 background flash if increase

metric_update.rationale: Clear indication of live data updates - maintains trust in system

scroll_to_top.rationale: Smooth scroll maintains context better than instant jump

parallax.usage: Minimal - use sparingly for hero sections only
parallax.rationale: Subtle depth adds polish without distraction. Avoid on pages with lots of content.

fade_in_on_scroll.rationale: Progressive disclosure - draws attention to new content as user scrolls

sticky_header_shrink.rationale: Maximizes content space while maintaining navigation access

fallbacks.transitions: Set all durations to 0ms or 50ms maximum
fallbacks.transforms: Replace with instant state changes or simple opacity
fallbacks.loading_states: Replace animated spinners with static icon or simple fade

exceptions.description: Some motion may remain even with reduced motion preference
allowed: Essential loading indicators (static or minimal motion)
Focus indicators (can use simple opacity instead of transforms)

testing.macos: System Preferences → Accessibility → Display → Reduce motion
testing.windows: Settings → Ease of Access → Display → Show animations
testing.browser_devtools: Chrome/Edge DevTools → Rendering → Emulate CSS media feature prefers-reduced-motion

reduced_motion.rationale: Critical for accessibility. Users with vestibular disorders, motion sensitivity, or cognitive conditions rely on this. It's not optional.

principles: Animate only transform and opacity when possible (GPU-accelerated)
Avoid animating width, height, top, left, margin (triggers layout)
Use will-change sparingly and remove after animation
Prefer CSS transitions/animations over JavaScript when possible
Test on low-end devices - animations should never drop below 30fps

optimization.will_change: Use on elements about to animate, remove after
optimization.transform_3d: Use translate3d() to force GPU acceleration
optimization.reduce_motion_query: Automatically improves performance for users who need it
optimization.debounce_scroll: Throttle scroll event handlers to max 60fps

design_system_integration.description: How motion integrates with other design system elements

color_transitions.note: Use OKLCH color space interpolation when available for perceptually uniform color transitions

typography_animations.guidance: Avoid animating font-size (causes layout shift). Instead, use scale transforms for emphasis.

spacing_animations.guidance: When animating spacing, prefer transform: translateX/Y over margin/padding changes

brand_moments.description: Special motion moments that reinforce the Oitavo Café brand

roi_reveal.context: Showing ROI calculations or results to Carolina
roi_reveal.rationale: ROI is the key value prop - make it feel significant

coffee_break_moment.animation: Subtle steam rising from coffee cup icon (SVG animation)
coffee_break_moment.usage: Onboarding completion, first sale through system, monthly reports
coffee_break_moment.rationale: Ties back to coffee heritage in moments of celebration

connection_established.context: Integration successful, connection made, system sync complete
connection_established.animation: Two dots moving toward each other and connecting (like the '8' infinity symbol)
connection_established.colors: primary-600 for dots, accent-500 for connection line
connection_established.rationale: Visual metaphor for 'connecting all the pieces' - core brand promise

antipatterns.description: What NOT to do - motion that breaks brand personality

avoid.why: Too playful - Oitavo Café is professional and results-focused, not Spotify
Can trigger motion sensitivity and feels gimmicky
avoid.instead: Reserve rotation for functional elements (arrows, loading spinners)

avoid.why: Wastes user's time - Carolina is busy and results-focused
Motion should always serve clarity, feedback, or guidance
avoid.instead: Ask: 'What does this animation communicate?' If no answer, remove it

avoid.why: Highlights slow performance instead of masking it
avoid.instead: Optimize performance first, use skeleton screens to show structure immediately

avoid.why: Distracting and bad for performance and accessibility
avoid.instead: One-time animations on state change, or very subtle pulses only

avoid.why: Feels desperate - brand should be confident, not shouty
avoid.instead: Use subtle emphasis (gentle scale, color shift, single pulse)

testing_checklist: Animations run smoothly (60fps) on mid-range devices
No animation relies solely on motion to convey information
Durations feel natural - not too fast (jarring) or too slow (sluggish)
Interactive elements provide immediate visual feedback (<100ms)
Loading states appear within 300ms if operation takes >1s
Easing curves feel natural for their context (enter vs exit)
Brand personality comes through (smooth, confident, purposeful)
Motion enhances clarity, never distracts from content

references: Material Design Motion System (adapted for brand personality)
Reduced Motion Media Query (WCAG 2.1 Success Criterion 2.3.3)
tools: Chrome DevTools Performance tab - FPS monitoring
Lottie - For complex brand moment animations if needed
